clinical_study.official_title: Age-related Changes in Sleep-wake Regulation: Effects of Sleep Loss on Possible Molecular Markers of Sleep Need

brief_summary.textblock: A sleep deprivation protocol combined with state-of-the-art, simultaneous positron emission tomography and magnetic resonance spectroscopy imaging will be employed to investigate the effects of sleep deprivation and aging on hypothesized molecular markers of sleep need.

primary_outcome.measure: Sleep-wake induced change in cerebral availability of mGluR5 (metabotropic glutamate receptors of subtype 5)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline metabotropic glutamate receptors of subtype 5 availability after 33 hours of prolonged wakefulness and 8 hours of recovery sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep-wake induced change in glutamate concentration in prefrontal cortex and basal ganglia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline glutamate concentration after 33 hours of prolonged wakefulness and 8 hours of recovery sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep-wake induced change in potential molecular markers of sleep need
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline microRNA, fragile X mental retardation protein and brain-derived neurotrophic factor concentrations after 33 hours of prolonged wakefulness and 8 hours of recovery sleep
secondary_outcome.description: microRNAs, fragile X mental retardation protein, and brain-derived neurotrophic factor concentrations in peripheral blood

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep-wake induced change in sleep electroencephalogram (EEG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from all-night baseline sleep EEG in 8 hours of recovery sleep after 33 hours of prolonged wakefulness
secondary_outcome.description: Spectral composition of the EEG during sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep-wake induced change in waking electroencephalogram (EEG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline waking EEG during 33 hours of prolonged wakefulness and after 8 hours of recovery sleep
secondary_outcome.description: Spectral composition of the EEG in wakefulness

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep-wake induced change in subjective state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline sleepiness during 33 hours of prolonged wakefulness and after 8 hours of recovery sleep
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective sleepiness as quantified with the Stanford Sleepiness Scale (range: 1 to 7)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep-wake induced change in cognitive performance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline cognitive performance during 33 hours of prolonged wakefulness and after 8 hours of recovery sleep
secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive performance battery including tasks measuring sustained attention, executive functioning and working memory

arm_group.description: Young study participants will complete four nights in the sleep laboratory, whereas they will stay awake during one night. PET brain imaging will be conducted at the same circadian time on three consecutive afternoons (prior, during and after prolonged wakefulness). Additionally, validated tests of vigilance and cognitive performance will be administered and the brain waves will be recorded in wakefulness and sleep.

Older study participants will complete four nights in the sleep laboratory, whereas they will stay awake during one night. PET brain imaging will be conducted at the same circadian time on three consecutive afternoons (prior, during and after prolonged wakefulness). Additionally, validated tests of vigilance and cognitive performance will be administered and the brain waves will be recorded in wakefulness and sleep.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy male individuals
- age: 20-35 or 60-70 years
- right-handed
- non-smokers
- moderate caffeine/alcohol consumption
- normal BMI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Sleep/circadian rhythms disturbances
- former brain injuries with loss of consciousness and brain anomalies
- drug intake/consumption
- medication intake
- cardiac pacemaker
- neurological disorders
- prior participation (during past 2 years) in radiological or nuclear experiment
